intro: Statice willdenowii, commonly known as sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. Its salt-tolerant nature makes it well adapted to maritime environments. Statice willdenowii is often used in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms and ornamental value.
